title: Chrissy Teigen told her new arm tattoo has 'Holocaust vibes'
text:

Chrissy Teigen has faced backlash for her new tattoo that appears to be a long list of numbers along her inner forearm.

The model, 33, was bombarded with comments on Instagram that criticised the star for not being sensitive to how the design mirrored tattoos that victims held in concentration camps were branded with by the Nazis.

She uploaded an image of her new inking for her fans to see, which she captioned: "Cool mom back at it again with @winterstone!!!!"

Proving some followers believed that Chrissy should have thought about the design prior to having it permanently etched onto her skin, they took to the comments under the collection of snaps that showed her during the tattoo session and the finished pattern.

(Image: Instagram)

One typed: "Wonderful. That’s what and how they tattooed holocaust survivors. Should have thought this one through."

"Yikes really strong Holocaust vibes," contributed one of her followers.

Another mused: "Remember when having numbers tattooed on your forearm was not so cool? Times changed. Good."

Some who were not keen of the likeness added: "Seems scary- like numbers tattooed during the Holocaust. I don’t like this" and "Is anyone else a little bothered by the fact that she got a series of numbers on her forearm? Is the Holocaust really that far removed from our reality? Anyone??"

(Image: Instagram)

(Image: Instagram)

A social media user urged: "Chrissy, I know you didn’t mean to evoke this with your tattoo, but I encourage you to look up the history of holocaust tattoos - a series of numbers forcibly given to people held in concentration camps to identify them. This has potential to be very offensive, even if that was not your intention."

"@chrissyteigen I respect your symbolism and it's your body to do what you want with but this makes me think of the Holocaust and the numbers they'd write" contributed a follower.

(Image: Barcroft)

A Instagram user asked: "Is it just me or does this look like concentration camp numbers that they would tattoo on ppl?"

Her husband John Legend penned below the gallery: "The ultimate mnemonic device!"

Chrissy, who is never one to shy away from responding to social media comments, is yet to respond to the comments.
